page.title: 03FLORA & FAUNA
page.content: The majority of trees are{deciduous e.g. Oak, Ash, Beech and Wild Cherry. Unfortunately, the Elm has almost vanished due to the Dutch Elm Disease spread by the Elm Bark Beetle.{ {Evergreens}are mainly Larch. Bluebells and Primroses abound in the woods, but the Marsh Marigold has almost disappeared. Campions, Foxgloves and Cow Parsley grow in profusion in the lanes. Many lovely Roe Deer roam in the woods. Foxes are increasing and there are several large Badger colonies, and plenty of Rabbits despite Myxomatosis. There are more Sparrow Hawks in the district - but fewer Owls and Skylarks. We are inundated with Magpies, and Wrens seem to be on the increase - which is pleasing.
